etymologies: late 18th century: via Afrikaans from Dutch, literally ‘chamois’, from gems ‘chamois’ + bok ‘buck’

definitions: a large antelope that has a gray coat, distinctive black-and-white head markings, and long straight horns, native to southwestern and East Africa.

notes.text: Oryx gazella, family Bovidae. See also oryx

shortDefinitions: large antelope that has grey coat, distinctive black-and-white head markings, and long straight horns, native to south-western and East Africa
